text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's newspapers on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Information minister David Mpamba says a plan to set up a journalists' media council must be approved by the government.
- The government tells public servants that it cannot negotiate pay rises now because it does not have the capacity to increase salaries.
- Landlords of the Zambian High Commission in South Africa threaten to take legal action against the Zambian government for failing to settle office rentals and telephone bills.
- A prominent church leader calls on Zambians to resort to mass demonstrations to force the government to address their concerns.
